title: Drawing, ca. 1790
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The door frame is shaped like an aedicule, with a circular pediment. The pedestals of the embedded columns are connected by a balustrade. They are flanked by the pedestals of pilaster strips and of statues. “Prudence” is shown at left, another allegorical figure of a woman at right. A royal escutcheon stands in front of the pediment with garlands hanging from it.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, ca. 1790. Graphite on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3666.
